description:
This extension associates a structure definition with a data dictionary - a collection of data elements that any instance of data that conforms to the structure definition must also conform to. The value of the extension is a uri the defines a query that identifies the collection of relevant data elements

This extension can be used on any structure definition that is a constraint on the resource types Observation and Questionnaire. THe profile specifies which elements are mandatory etc., but any elements in a resource that conforms to the structure definition must also conform to one of the defined data elements.

For Observation:
* Observation.code must be associated with a matching Data Element by DataElement.code. 
* The structure definition should bind Observation.code to a value set that has the same codes as the collection of data elements (though it can be narrower)
* the unit and the quantity value should conform to the rules laid down in the matching Data Element

For Questionnaire:
* todo.

element.comments: The query can select a set of data element resources, or identify a bundle that is a collection of data elements.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Associates the structure definition with a collection of Data Elements

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.comments: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension

element.definition: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).

title: Data Dictionary
